      "text": "National Planning Council 7 State of Qatar + ‏دولة قطر‎ National Data Management Guidelines Data Quality Management 1, 0 7,١ 34 ' . 2. 14559 . '.‘-.. o 8} \"I \"4 K g% + ادا م 00 Table of Contents 1. Data Quality Management Domain Introduction 1.1 Domain Overview 1.2 Target Audience 1.3 Abbreviations and Glossary 1.4 Readability Guide 1.5 Stakeholders Involved 1.6 Key Success Factors 1.7 Compliance with National Data Standards 1.8 Data Quality Management Process Map 2. Data Quality Policy Overview 2.1. Data Quality Policy Creation 2.2. Data Quality Policy Publication 3. Data Quality Planning Overview 3.1. Data Profiling 3.2. Data Quality Plan 4. Data Quality Implementation Overview 4.1. Data Quality Rules & Thresholds 4.2. Data Quality Tool Implementation 5. Data Quality Issue Management Overview 5.1. Data Quality Issues Management and Remediation Process 6. Data Quality Performance Management Overview 6.1. Data Quality KPIs 6.2. Data Quality Monitoring & Reporting 6.3.QDTI 6.3. Data Quality SLAs 7. Appendix 7.1. Templates and Frameworks 1.1 Domain Overview Data quality refers to the overall condition of data as assessed by criteria such as accuracy, completeness, consistency, validity, and timeliness. Evaluating data quality levels enables Entities to identify errors and inconsistencies that require resolution, ensuring that the data housed in IT systems meets the expectations and needs of its users. Data Quality Management (DQM) includes the planning, implementation, and oversight of activities that employ quality management techniques to ensure data is fit for use and aligns with the requirements of data consumers. Effective DQM not only enhances the integrity of data but also promotes trust among stakeholders who rely on this information for decision-making. Key Components of the Data Quality Management Domain: 2. Data Quality Policy The Data Quality Policy is the cornerstone of an Entity's data governance framework, ensuring that data assets are managed effectively and consistently. This policy outlines the frameworks, principles, and practices necessary to maintain high-quality data, supporting the Entity's strategic objectives. * Data Quality Policy Creation: Creating a Data Quality Policy involves defining the principles, guidelines, and standards that ensure data accuracy, completeness, consistency, reliability, and timeliness. This process requires collaboration across various stakeholders to align the policy with the Entity's goals and regulatory requirements. * Data Quality Policy Publication: Once the Data Quality Policy is created, it must be formally documented and communicated ‏م‎ all relevant stakeholders. This publication process includes disseminating the policy through official channels, ensuring accessibility, and providing training and resources to support adherence. 3. Data Quality Planning Data Quality Planning is a proactive approach ‏ما‎ managing data quality, focusing on identifying potential data issues and establishing measures ‏ما‎ address them. It involves detailed analysis and strategic planning ‏ما‎ integrate data quality management into the Entity's operations. * Data Profiling: Data Profiling is the initial step in data quality planning, involving the examination of data sources to understand their structure, content, and interrelationships. This process helps identify data anomalies, inconsistencies, and potential quality issues that need to be addressed. * Data Quality Plan: The Data Quality Plan outlines specific actions and resources required to address identified data quality issues. This plan includes setting objectives, defining key performance indicators (KPIs), allocating responsibilities, and establishing timelines to ensure continuous improvement in data quality. 4. Data Quality Implementation Data Quality Implementation translates the relevant data management policies and plans into actionable practices. It involves deploying tools, defining rules, and establishing processes to ensure that data quality standards are met throughout the data lifecycle. Data Quality Rules & Thresholds: Defining Data Quality Rules and Thresholds involves setting specific criteria for data quality, such as acceptable levels of accuracy, completeness, and consistency. These rules and thresholds guide data validation processes and ensure that data meets the required standards. Data Quality Tool Implementation: Implementing Data Quality Tools involves selecting and deploying software solutions that automate data quality tasks, such as data cleansing, validation, and monitoring. These tools support the enforcement of data quality rules and facilitate ongoing quality management. 5. Data Quality Issue Management Data Quality Issue Management focuses on identifying, tracking, and resolving data quality issues. This process ensures that data anomalies are promptly addressed to maintain data integrity and reliability. Data Quality Issues Management and Remediation Process: The Data Quality Issues Management and Remediation Process outlines the steps for logging and prioritizing data quality issues, analyzing their root causes, and implementing corrective and preventive actions. This process ensures systematic handling of data quality problems ‏م‎ prevent recurrence and improve overall data quality. 6. Data Quality Performance Management Data Quality Performance Management involves monitoring, measuring, and reporting on data quality to ensure continuous improvement. This process integrates performance metrics and feedback mechanisms to sustain high data quality standards. Data Quality KPlIs: Data Quality Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) are metrics used to assess the effectiveness of data quality management efforts. KPIs provide quantifiable measures of data quality, such as error rates, data completeness, and timeliness, guiding decision-making and improvement initiatives. Data Quality Monitoring & Reporting: Data Quality Monitoring and Reporting involves ongoing surveillance of data quality metrics and the generation of reports to communicate performance to stakeholders. This process ‏كماعط‎ identify trends, track progress, and highlight areas needing attention. QDTI: Evaluating ‏عط‎ Entity's adherence ‏م‎ the National Data Quality Management Standards and the Data Quality Assessment results to determine the Data Quality Score (DQS), a key component of the Qatar Data Trust Index (QDT]I) score. Data Quality SLAs: Data Quality Service Level Agreements (SLAs) define the expected quality standards and performance levels for data management. SLAs establish clear expectations between data providers and consumers, ensuring accountability and alignment with organizational goals. 1.2 Target Audience This Data Quality Domain handbook is intended for business users and the Entity’'s Data Quality working group including ‏عط‎ Data Quality Specialist, Data Owners, Stewards, and Analysts who are responsible for defining the data quality requirements across the different data domains and developing appropriate measures for assessing and improving the data quality levels within the Entity. This is demonstrated through detailed step by step processes, activities, and",
      "standardName": "Unknown Standard",
      "domain": "Data Quality Management",
      "version": "1.0",
      "chunkIndex": 0,

      }
    }
